quotes: "Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone and anvil, is rightwise king born of all England." - Sir Thomas Malory
"The sweetness of love is short-lived, but the pain endures." - Sir Thomas Malory
"We shall now seek that which we shall not find." - Sir Thomas Malory

"Nay, I may not so, for I have promised to do the battle to the uttermost by the faith of my body, while me lasteth the life, and therefore I had liefer to die with honour than to live with shame; and if it were possible for me to die an hundred times, I had liefer to die so oft than yield me to thee; for though I lack weapon, I shall lack no worship, and if thou slay me weaponless that shall be thy shame." - King Arthur to Sir Accolon, Sir Thomas Malory
